turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Did I say something wrong?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I suffer from insomnia.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Is that all?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: When I do sleep, I sweat a lot. Usually I get nightmares and wake up screaming.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: I sleep like a dead horse. Anything else?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Hey, there.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Why do you want to know?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Because I like you.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: What's the worst thing you ever did?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: The worst?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: So, what did you do?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I molested little girls.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Molested little girls?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: You're not joking.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Twelve years in prison is no joke.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Look, you can go now.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: How many girls did you molest?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: What did you do to them?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: It's not what you think.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: How young?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Between ten and twelve. Once a nine- year-old told me she was eleven. Once a fourteen-year-old told me she was twelve. I always asked how old they were.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I never hurt them. Never.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Twelve years in prison?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: The judge had a thing about sex offenders. Later I heard his daughter had been raped. If I hadn't had a good lawyer, it would have been twenty- five to thirty.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Why don't you just go now, okay?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: I told you I'm not easily shocked.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You should be shocked. Or do you get off on this shit?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Get your kicks somewhere else.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Hey, I'm not --

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Depraved? My mistake.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Walter.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: You don't molest little girls anymore, do you?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: No. Never again.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: What was prison like?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You don't really --

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Yes! I want to know.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: You mean the time you're locked away?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: No. Prison is time. That's it. You think time, you feel time, you hear time. Your heart doesn't beat to live, it just beats... time.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: I'm sorry, Walter.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Don't be sorry for me. I did those things. No one else did. I'm dealing with that.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: My father took me fishing here when I was a kid. He could name every fish in the lake. And for every fish he named, he had a fishing story. I hated fishing, but I loved his stories.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Sounds like a special guy.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: My father was an alcoholic who drank himself right into the grave.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I've changed.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Why young girls, Walter?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Is it their innocence? Their beauty?...

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Their power. They seduce me.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: They seduce you?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I was always the one seduced.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: You really believe that?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: No. That's what I used to tell myself.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: And what do you tell yourself now?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Nothing. It's over.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Bullshit.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You know, this is crazy.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Being here, with me.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Most people say the odds are against me.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: What odds?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: The percentages --

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: For men like me. They say most of us end up back... there. I'm saying there are risks... seeing me.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Well, most people are stupid.  You want to talk about odds? One day I'll tell you how I survived as the youngest in a family of three sons. You wanna talk about odds?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Why not tell me now?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: I got poked around... here and there.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Which brother did this?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: All three -- in chronological order.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You must hate your brothers.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: I love my brothers.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: No you don't.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: I love all of them. They're strong, gentle men with families of their own. And if you asked them about what they did to me, they'd call you a fucking liar and then beat the shit out of you.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You never asked them about it?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Are you serious?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Not ever?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Not ever.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Maybe this isn't a good idea.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Us seeing each other.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: You're scared.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I'm not scared.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Neither am I.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Maybe you should be.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: We should live together.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Live together.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Move in with me.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: It's a bad idea.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: I think it's a fucking good idea.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I don't even know how to live with myself.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Just think about it.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I've got problems.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Who doesn't?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Most people don't have my kind of problems.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Guess that makes you pretty special.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: That's not what I meant.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I say we call it quits.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: What's it look like?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I don't need a plant.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Everyone needs a plant. This ivy is one tough baby. It's a cutting from one of mine.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: You're such an asshole.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Don't be scared, Walter.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I'm not scared.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Prove it.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Don't do that.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Do what?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Sneak up behind me like that.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: What's your fucking problem?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Why's it always my fucking problem?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I didn't sleep well.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Do you want to talk about it?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I need a shower.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Fucking liar.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I heard they were filthy birds.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Not when they fly.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Goddamnit!  D'you tell him we need it right now?

turns.speaker: ONE NIGHT
turns.text: I told him we had to get the umbilical unhooked ASAP.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: This ain't no drill, slick.  Make me proud.

turns.speaker: ONE NIGHT
turns.text: Piece of cake, baby.

turns.speaker: ONE NIGHT
turns.text: Right through the brainpan.  Deader'n dogshit, boss.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Where're you?

turns.speaker: ONE NIGHT
turns.text: Gimme a three-eighths socket on a long extension.  So there you were--

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: There we were, side by side, on the same ship, for two months.  I'm tool-pusher and we're testing this automated derrick of hers.  So, we get back on the beach and... we're living together.

turns.speaker: ONE NIGHT
turns.text: Doesn't mean you had to marry her.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: We were due to go back out on the same ship. Six months of tests.  If you were married you got a state-room.  Otherwise it was bunks.

turns.speaker: ONE NIGHT
turns.text: Okay, good reason.  Then what?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: It was alright for a while, you know.  But then she got promoted to project engineer on this thing, couple years ago.

turns.speaker: ONE NIGHT
turns.text: She went front-office on you.  Tighten that for me, right there.  That's it.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Well, you know Lindsey, too damn aggressive-- Son of a--!!

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: You done impressing yourself, ace?

turns.speaker: ONE NIGHT
turns.text: No way that could just be seawater.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: She-hit.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: We're being asked to cooperate in a matter of national security.  Now you know exactly as much as I do.  So just get your gear off and get up to control.  There's some kind of briefing in ten minutes.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: How you guys doing?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I'm alright, I'm dealing.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: You got it?!  You got it?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Yeah, yeah... yeah.  It's turning.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Benthic Explorer, Benthic Explorer.  Do you read, over?  This is Deepcore--

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Forget it, Sonny.  They're gone.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Nice shot, Lins.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: What is that?  You drop your dive light?

turns.speaker: JAMMER
turns.text: Bud!  Hippy's on the bitch-box.  It's a call from topside.  That new company man.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Kirkhill?  That guy doesn't know his butt from a rathole.  Hey, Perry!

turns.speaker: JAMMER
turns.text: What's goin' on, Boss?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Folks, I've just been told to shut down the hole and prepare to move the rig.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Okay so far.

turns.speaker: JAMMER
turns.text: How deep's the drop-off here?

turns.speaker: JAMMER
turns.text: Where are we?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Missile compartment.  Those are the launch tubes.

turns.speaker: JAMMER
turns.text: Lord Almighty.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Hey, you okay?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Deep and slow, big guy.  Deep and slow.  Just breathe easy.

turns.speaker: JAMMER
turns.text: I... they're all dead, Bud.  They're all dead. I thought... some of them... you know...

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: I'm taking you back out.

turns.speaker: JAMMER
turns.text: No!  I'm okay now.  I just don't... I can't go any further in.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Okay, Jammer.  No problem.  You stay right here. I have to go there to the end... you'll see my lights.  We'll stay in voice contact.  Just hold onto the rope.  Five more minutes.  Okay?

turns.speaker: JAMMER
turns.text: Yeah, okay.  Okay.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Thanks.  How you feeling, big guy?

turns.speaker: JAMMER
turns.text: Figured I was dead, there, when I seen that angel comin' toward me.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: I can't believe you let them do this!

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Hi, Lins.  I thought you were in Houston.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: I was, but I managed to bum a ride on the last flight out here.  Only here isn't where I left it, is it, Bud?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Wasn't up to me.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: We were that close to proving a submersible drilling platform could work.  We had over seven thousand feet of hole down for Chrissake.  I can't believe you let them grab my rig!

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Your rig?

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: My rig.  I designed the damn thing.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Yup, a Benthic Petroleum paid for it.  So as long as they're hold the pink slip, I go where they tell me.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: You wimp.  I had a lot riding on this.  They bought you... more like least rented you cheap--

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: I'm switching off now.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Virgil, you wiener!  You never could stand up to fight.  You--

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Well, well.  Mrs. Brigman.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Not for long.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: You never did like being called that, did you?

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Not even when it meant something.  Is that One Night up in Flatbed?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Who else?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: I can't believe you were dumb enough to come down.  Now you're stuck here for the storm... dumb, hot-rod... dumb.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Look, I didn't come down here to fight.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: You need me.  Nobody knows the systems on this rig better than I do.  What is something was to go wrong after the Explorer clears off?  What would have you done?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Wow, you're right!  Us poor dumb ol' boys might've had to think for ourselves.  Coulda been a disaster.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: You wanna know what I think?

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Not particularly.  Jeez, look where this is set! Morons.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: I think you were worried about me.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: That must be it.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: No, I think you were.  Come on, admit it.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: I was worried about the rig.  I've got over four years invested in this project.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Oh, yeah, right... and you only had three years with me.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: What are you still wearing that for?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: I don't know.  Divorce ain't final.  Forgot to take it off.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: I haven't worn mine in months.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Yeah, what's-his-name wouldn't like it.  The Suit.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Do you always have to call him that?  The Suit? It makes you sound like such a hick.  His name is Michael.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: So what about "Michael" then... Mr. Brooks Brothers... Mr. BMW.  You still seeing him?

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: No, I haven't seen him in a few weeks.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Bud, why are you doing this?  It's not part of you life any more.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: I'll tell you what happened... you woke up one day and realized the guy never made you laugh.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: You're right, Bud.  It was just that simple. Aren't you clever?  You should get your own show... Ask Dr. Bud, advice to the lovelorn from three hundred fathoms.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Did you get anything on the cameras.  Video or anything?

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: No.  Look, forget it.  I don't want to talk about it.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Fine.  Be that way.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: I don't know what I saw.  Okay?  Coffey wants to call it a Russian submersible, fine.  It's a Russian submersible.  No problem.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: But you think it's something else.  What?  One of ours?

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Whose then?  Lindsey?  Talk to me...

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Jammer saw something in there, something that scared the hell out him--

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: His mixture got screwed up.  He panicked and pranged his regulator.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: But what did he see that made him panic?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: What do you think he saw?

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: I don't know.  I DON'T KNOW!

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Hippy, just relax.  You're making the women nervous.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Cute, Virgil.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: What's the scoop, ace?

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: I can get power to this module and sub-bay if I remote these busses.  I've gotta get past the mains, which are a total melt-down.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Need some help?

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Thanks.  No, I can handle it.  Bud... there won't be enough to run the heaters.  In a couple hours this place is going to be as cold as a meat locker.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: What about O-2?

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Brace yourself.  We've got about 12 hours worth if we close off the sections we're not using.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: The storm's gonna last longer than 12 hours.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: I can extend that.  There's some storage tanks outboard on the wrecked module.  I'll have to go outside to tie onto them.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Hey, Lins...  I'm glad your here.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Yeah?  Well I'm not.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Come on, you guys... look, this is the little one right here.  You can see how it's kind of zigging around.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: If you say so.  It could be anything.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: I'm telling you what is there.  You're just not hearing.  The impulses somehow aren't getting from you ears to your brainpan.  There's something down there.  Something not... us.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Jesus, Lindsey--

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Bud, something really important is happening here.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Look.  I'm just trying to hold this situation together.  I can't allow you to cause this kind of hysteria--

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Who's hysterical?  Nobody's hysterical!

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: All I'm saying is when you're hanging on by your fingernails, you don't go waving you arms around.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: I saw something!  I'm not going to go back there and say I didn't see it when I did.  I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: God, you are the most stubborn woman I ever knew.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: I need you to believe me, Bud.  Look at me.  Do I seem stressed out?  Any of the symptoms of pressure sickness, any tremors, slurred speech?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Bud, this is me, Lindsey.  Okay?  You know me better than anybody in the world.  Now watch my lips... I saw these things.  I touched one of them.  And it wasn't some clunky steel can like we would build... it glided.  It was the most beautiful thing I've ever seen.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: It was a machine, but it seems almost alive. Like a... dance of light.  Bud, you have to trust me... please.  I don't think they mean us harm.  I don't know how I know that, it's just a feeling.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: How can I go on a feeling?  You think Coffey's going to go on you 'feeling'?

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: We all see what we want to see... Coffey looks and he sees Russians, he sees hate and fear. Bud, you have to look with better eyes than that.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Look, goddamnit, if you won't do something about it, I will.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Lindsey!  Wait a second--

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: You dumb jarhead motherf--

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Chill out, Lindsey!!

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: He's got the shakes?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Look, the guy's operating on his own, cut off from chain of command.  He's exhibiting symptoms of pressure-induced psychosis.  And he's got a nuclear weapon.  So, as a personal favor to me... will you put your tongue in neutral for a while?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: I think it likes you.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: It's trying to communicate.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: They must've learned how to control water... I mean at a molecular level.  They can plasticize it, polymerize it... whatever.  Put it under intelligent control.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Maybe their whole technology is based on that. Controlling water.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: He's jammed the mechanism.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Now what?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Okay, I'm gonna free-swim to hatch six... get inside, get the door open from the other side.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Bud, that water's only a couple degrees above freezing.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Then I guess you better wish me luck, huh?

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: You owe me one, Virgil.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Can we negotiate later?  There's Big Geek.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: You did okay, back there.  I was fairly impressed.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Not good enough.  We still gotta catch Big Geek.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Not in this thing.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: You totaled it, huh?

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Yeah.  So sue me.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: It's flooding like a son of the bitch.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: You noticed.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Try again.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Deepcore, this is Cab One.  We need assistance, over.  Deepcore, this--

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Well, that's that.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Wonderful.  There's some light from somewhere...

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Good hundred yards, I'd say.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: They'll come out after us.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Yeah, but it's gonna take them a while to find us.  We better get this flooding stopped.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: You see where it's coming in?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Somewhere behind this panel.  Hold this.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Can't get to it.  Have to pull this panel off. You go any tools?

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: I don't know, look around.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Son of a bitch!

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Calm down, Bud.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Okay... okay.  We gotta get you out of here.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: I don't know how!

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: We've only got one suit.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: I know!  I know!  But we better come up with something.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Aaargh!!  I'm freezing!

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Okay, look, you swim to the rig and come back with another suit.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Seven, eight minute swim each way... not enough time.  Look at this...  Time I get back you'll be--

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Alright, put this on.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: What, you growing gills all of a sudden?  You got it on, keep it on.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Don't argue, goddamnit, just--

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: No way!  Forget it.  Not an option.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Lindsey, just put the thing on and shut up--

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: NO!!  Now be logical, Bud, you're--

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: FUCK LOGIC!!

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Listen... will you listen to me for a second!? You're for the suit on and you're a better swimmer than me.  Right?  So I got a plan...

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: What's the plan?

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: I drown, you tow me back to the rig--

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: WHAT KIND OF PLAN IS THAT!??

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: It is insane.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: It's the only way, Bud.  Now trust me.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Oh God, Lins... I--

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Tell me later.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Hey... big boys don't cry, remember?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Hi, lady.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Hi, tough guy.  I guess it worked, huh?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: 'Course is worked.  You're never wrong, are you? How d'you feel.

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: I've been better.  Next time it's your turn, okay?

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: No, Bud, no... not you.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Who then?

turns.speaker: LINDSEY
turns.text: Hello, Brigman.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Hello, Mrs. Brigman.
